title: The Silent Patient
description: A woman shoots her husband and then never speaks another word. A psychological thriller that explores the mind of a psychotherapist determined to get her to talk.

title: Gone Girl
description: A woman disappears on her fifth wedding anniversary. As the investigation unfolds it becomes clear that nothing is as it seems in this twisted psychological thriller.

title: The Woman in the Window
description: An agoraphobic woman witnesses a crime in a neighboring house but no one believes her. Twists and turns abound in this Hitchcockian thriller.

title: Sharp Objects
description: A reporter returns to her hometown to cover the murders of two preteen girls. A dark psychological thriller exploring family trauma.

title: The Girl on the Train
description: A commuter fantasizes about a seemingly perfect couple she sees during her daily train ride until she becomes entangled in a missing persons investigation.

title: Before I Go to Sleep
description: A woman with anterograde amnesia wakes up every day with no memory of who she is. Through her journal she tries to reconstruct her life with shocking discoveries.

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: Harvard professor Robert Langdon follows clues in Da Vinci paintings to uncover ancient secrets that could shake the foundations of Christianity.

title: Educated
description: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a survivalist family in Idaho and eventually earns a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: The Hunger Games
description: In a dystopian future young people are forced to fight to the death in an annual televised spectacle.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
description: A coming-of-age story about a young girl who grows up isolated in the marshes of North Carolina and becomes a suspect in a murder.

title: Normal People
description: A complex coming-of-age love story following two Irish teenagers as they navigate high school college and beyond.

title: The Alchemist
description: A fable about following one's dreams featuring a shepherd boy who travels to the Egyptian pyramids in search of treasure.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
description: Set in a near-future New England in a totalitarian state that has overthrown the U.S. government.
A classic novel about a totalitarian future society and one man's attempt to rebel against the system.

title: Becoming
description: The memoir of the former First Lady of the United States describing her experiences from childhood through the end of Barack Obama's presidency.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel telling the story of racial injustice in the Depression-era South through the eyes of a young girl.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series follows a young wizard beginning his education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Midnight Library
description: A novel about a library between life and death where each book represents a different version of your life.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
description: A reclusive Hollywood star recounts her life story including her seven marriages to a young journalist.

title: A Little Life
description: A novel following the lives of four college classmates in New York City focusing on one with a mysterious past filled with trauma.

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel set in the Jazz Age on Long Island depicting a cast of characters living in the fictional towns of West Egg and East Egg.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
description: A novel that explores the weight of secrets the ferocity of motherhood and the danger of perfection in a picture-perfect Cleveland suburb.

title: The Testaments
description: The sequel to The Handmaid's Tale set 15 years after the events of the original novel.

title: Atomic Habits
description: A guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones using proven systems from biology psychology and neuroscience.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
description: A book that spans the whole of human history from the evolution of Homo sapiens to the political and technological revolutions of the 21st century.

title: The Nightingale
description: A novel about two sisters in France during World War II and their struggle to survive and resist the German occupation.

title: The Song of Achilles
description: A retelling of the story of Achilles and the Trojan War from the perspective of his companion Patroclus.

title: It Ends with Us
description: A novel about a woman who meets a neurosurgeon who reminds her of her first love while dealing with her abusive father's death.

title: The Four Winds
description: A novel about a woman's experience during the Great Depression and the Dust Bowl era.

title: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
description: A novel about a woman who makes a Faustian bargain to live forever but is cursed to be forgotten by everyone she meets.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A novel of manners about the relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy set in rural England in the early 19th century.

title: The Kite Runner
description: A novel about the friendship between a wealthy boy and the son of his father's servant in Afghanistan before the Soviet invasion.

title: Circe
description: A retelling of the story of Circe a sorceress in Greek mythology who appears in Homer's Odyssey.

title: Dune
description: A science fiction novel set in the distant future amidst a feudal interstellar society where noble houses control individual planets.

title: The Vanishing Half
description: A novel about identical twin sisters who run away from their small Black community at age 16 and live very different lives.

title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
description: A novel about a huntress who is brought into the faerie world as punishment for killing a wolf who is revealed to be a faerie.

title: The Book Thief
description: A novel about the efforts of a young girl to steal books in Nazi Germany narrated by Death.

title: Mexican Gothic
description: A novel set in 1950s Mexico where a woman investigates her cousin's claims about her husband's family's sinister history.

title: The Guest List
description: A novel about a wedding celebration at a remote island off the coast of Ireland that turns deadly.

title: A Gentleman in Moscow
description: A novel about a Russian count who is placed under house arrest in the Metropol Hotel in Moscow by the Bolsheviks.

title: Red White & Royal Blue
description: A novel about the First Son of the United States falling in love with a British Prince.

title: The Giver of Stars
description: A novel about five women who become traveling librarians in rural Kentucky during the Great Depression.

title: Ready Player One
description: A novel set in a dystopian future where humanity escapes reality in the virtual world OASIS.

title: Dark Matter
description: A novel about a physics professor who is knocked unconscious and awakens to a life he doesn't recognize.

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea
description: A novel about a caseworker at the Department in Charge of Magical Youth who is sent to inspect an orphanage for magical children.

title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
description: A novel about a socially awkward woman who forms a friendship with a coworker and an elderly man after they help a man who has fallen on the sidewalk.

title: Project Hail Mary
description: A novel about an astronaut who wakes up on a spaceship with no memory and a mission to save Earth from extinction.

title: Jane Eyre
description: A novel about an orphan who becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer Mr. Rochester.

title: The Hobbit
description: A novel about a hobbit who embarks on a quest to help a group of dwarves reclaim their mountain home from a dragon.

title: The Goldfinch
description: A novel about a young boy who survives a terrorist bombing at an art museum that kills his mother and steals a painting in the aftermath.

title: Anxious People
description: A novel about a failed bank robber who takes a group of strangers hostage at an apartment open house.

title: Klara and the Sun
description: A novel narrated by an Artificial Friend a humanoid robot designed to be a child's companion.

title: The Queen's Gambit
description: A novel about an orphaned chess prodigy who struggles with addiction in her quest to become the world's greatest chess player.

title: The Thursday Murder Club
description: A novel about four septuagenarians who meet weekly to solve cold cases and find themselves in the middle of a live murder investigation.

title: Braiding Sweetgrass
description: A book that explores the relationship between humans and nature through indigenous wisdom scientific knowledge and personal anecdotes.

title: A Darker Shade of Magic
description: A novel about a magician who can travel between parallel Londons: Red Grey and White.

title: On Earth We're Briefly Gorgeous
description: A novel written as a letter from a son to his illiterate mother exploring family history race sexuality and the immigrant experience.

title: Wolf Hall
description: A novel about Thomas Cromwell's rise to power in the court of Henry VIII.

title: The Fifth Season
description: A novel set in a world where catastrophic climate change occurs every few centuries and is known as a \Fifth Season.\""

title: Such a Fun Age
description: A novel about a young Black babysitter accused of kidnapping a child in her care and the child's well-intentioned employer who tries to help.

title: Untamed
description: A memoir about the author's journey to finding her true self and authentic voice after divorce.

title: The Night Circus
description: A novel about a mysterious circus that arrives without warning and is only open at night.

title: Daisy Jones & The Six
description: A novel written as an oral history of a fictional 1970s rock band documenting their rise and fall.

title: Hamnet
description: A novel about Shakespeare's family particularly his wife Agnes and the death of their son Hamnet from the plague.

title: Piranesi
description: A novel about a man who lives in a house with infinite rooms filled with statues and whose only visitor is a man called The Other.
